data.event: With her stunning red hair flaming, Rebecca Mays cozily sat on her papaw’s lap Saturday night, listening to Kentucky’s top politicos make rousing speeches at the Lincoln Day Dinner.

event.title: welcomed into the prestigious club Saturday

data.event: Johnson was one of four inductees — and the only Laurel County resident — welcomed into the prestigious club Saturday.

event.title: entered the political arena himself in the early 1970s

data.event: Johnson entered the political arena himself in the early 1970s when he ran for sheriff at the age of 31.
In 1985, he won the clerk’s seat and has occupied it ever since.

event.title: his first vote for Richard Nixon in 1960

data.event: Through it all, he has been a staunch Republican supporter, voting for Republican presidents and governors ever since he cast his first vote for Richard Nixon in 1960 at the age of 18.
Of Saturday’s dinner, Johnson said he enjoyed speeches given by Senate President David Williams, U.S. Rep. Harold “Hal” Rogers and U.S. Sens. Mitch McConnell and Jim Bunning.
I think in two years, there will be a reversal.
